channel.title: Whalesbook Financial News
channel.description: Latest Indian and global financial market news

item.title: Edtech Shock: StudyIQ Co-founder Gaurav Garg Exits Adda247-Owned Platform Amid Sector Turmoil!
item.description: Gaurav Garg, co-founder and managing director of StudyIQ, has stepped down from the Adda247-owned edtech platform. Founded in 2015 and acquired by Adda247 in 2021 for $20 million, StudyIQ has a strong user base. Despite doubling revenue to INR 76.7 Cr in FY24 and reducing losses, Garg's departure adds to the ongoing churn in India's edtech sector, which is seeing both challenges and renewed investor interest.

item.title: Radico Khaitan's Premium Play: Is This the Secret to Soaring Spirits Demand?
item.description: Radico Khaitan is strategically boosting its focus on the premium and above (P&A) spirits segment, anticipating significant demand growth driven by consumers trading up. Managing Director Abhishek Khaitan expects 30% growth from the super-premium segment, which already constitutes 68% of sales value. This push is fueled by rising consumer aspirations, younger demographics, and demand from tier-II markets, with the P&A segment projected for 15% annual growth over three years.

item.title: AI Smartphones Set to Explode: Is Your Next Phone a Genius?
item.description: Smartphones in 2026 will heavily feature on-device Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a key differentiator, driven by advanced chips enabling features like summarization and image creation. Despite rising hardware costs, particularly for memory, AI phone shipments are surging globally and in India. While average selling prices for AI-capable phones are decreasing, overall smartphone prices are expected to rise. Companies like Samsung are prioritizing privacy and affordability in their AI strategies, preparing for major announcements at the Consumer Electronics Show. Consumer demand for AI features is growing, though privacy remains a concern.

item.title: Syska LED Insolvency: Promoter, German Giant Mutares, and 2 Others Vie for Control Amidst Lender Concerns
item.description: Syska LED Lights' insolvency proceedings have attracted four potential bidders: the company's promoter, Germany's Mutares Group, Aikyam Stressed Asset Fund, and Cyfuture India. Lenders, led by State Bank of India with a ₹77 crore exposure, are reviewing bids amid concerns over the validity of some applications lacking formal board authorization. Syska LED faces claims of ₹226 crore, with lenders expecting recoveries potentially exceeding 50%.

item.title: RBI Drops Major Hint on NBFC Regulation Overhaul: Is Your Investment Safe?
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has begun a review of its scale-based regulation (SBR) framework for non-bank lenders (NBFCs). This move acknowledges the rapidly growing role of NBFCs in delivering credit across India. The review considers their increasing systemic importance and asset base, aiming to adapt regulations to current market dynamics and potential risks. This could lead to stricter norms for upper-layer NBFCs, which already hold a significant portion of the sector's assets.

item.title: RBI's STARK Warning: India's NBFCs Hit Record Size, Yet Micro-Lending Cracks Widen!
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India's latest report shows that Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs) saw their balance sheets expand significantly by 18.9% to ₹61.09 lakh crore in FY25, driven by strong loan growth. However, the microfinance segment is experiencing significant stress, with Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) doubling to 4.1%. While overall asset quality improved, total profits for all NBFCs slightly decreased.

item.title: US LPG Deals Force India Govt's Hand: Major Subsidy Formula Overhaul Looms!
item.description: The Indian government is considering a significant revamp of its LPG subsidy calculation formula. This potential change follows state-run oil companies—Indian Oil Corp, Bharat Petroleum Corp Ltd, and Hindustan Petroleum Corp Ltd—signing their first-ever term contracts to import LPG from the United States. The new formula might incorporate US benchmark prices and higher transatlantic shipping costs, moving away from the current reliance solely on Saudi Contract Price.

item.title: Government Plans ₹3.84 Lakh Crore Borrowing Via Treasury Bills in Q4
item.description: India's government plans to borrow ₹3.84 lakh crore through short-term treasury bills in the fourth quarter to fund its immediate needs. Weekly auctions will range from ₹29,000 crore to ₹35,000 crore, a slight decrease from the previous year. The borrowing schedule remains flexible, adjustable in consultation with the Reserve Bank of India based on market conditions.

item.title: Hindalco's Novelis Secures $750 Million Boost: Future Growth on Track?
item.description: Novelis, Hindalco Industries Ltd's subsidiary, has secured $750 million through a share subscription deal with its sole shareholder, AV Minerals. The funds aim to support future growth, with Hindalco's MD anticipating strong performance by FY27, despite recent operational challenges like plant fires. The company is also advancing its large-scale Bay Minette project in the US.

item.title: India Govt Unveils Massive ₹3.84 Lakh Crore Borrowing Plan for Q4: Market Movers Ahead!
item.description: The Indian government announced plans to borrow ₹3.84 lakh crore through short-term treasury bills during the fourth quarter (Q4) of the current financial year. This borrowing aims to manage short-term funding needs. The amount represents a decrease of ₹10,000 crore compared to the ₹3.94 lakh crore borrowed in the same quarter last year. The Finance Ministry, in consultation with the Reserve Bank of India, retains flexibility to adjust borrowing amounts and timing based on market conditions.

item.title: Private Bank Jobs Plummet in FY25! ICICI Bank Leads Exodus, PSU Banks See Slight Rise
item.description: Indian private sector banks reduced their workforce in fiscal year 2025, primarily driven by a significant drop at ICICI Bank. In contrast, public sector banks reported a marginal increase in employees. Overall banking system employment grew, thanks to substantial hiring by Small Finance Banks.

item.title: BSE's Shocking F&O Turnover EXPLOSION: How They Toppled NSE Amidst Sebi's Tight Grip!
item.description: The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) has seen its futures and options average daily premium turnover skyrocket by 1,539% over the past two years, reaching ₹15,325 crore recently. This remarkable growth occurred even as the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) imposed several restrictive regulations. Experts attribute BSE's success to its Sensex contracts attracting traders and the addition of institutional clients, while the National Stock Exchange (NSE) experienced a significant fall in its turnover during the same period.

item.title: OneCard's Revenue Skyrockets 32% to ₹1,878 Crore in FY25 as Losses Shrink Dramatically!
item.description: Mobile-first credit card startup OneCard, operated by FPL Technologies, has reported a significant 32% jump in revenue for FY25, reaching ₹1,878 crore from ₹1,425.5 crore in FY24. Total revenue crossed ₹1,900 crore. The company also successfully narrowed its losses by 26% to ₹297.5 crore, down from ₹401 crore in the previous fiscal year. This growth was driven by its credit card operations and the OneScore app, even amidst increasing regulatory attention on co-branded cards.

item.title: India's Blockchain Boom: Aptos Sees Over Half Its 20 Million Wallets From India!
item.description: Blockchain platform Aptos has achieved over 20 million monthly active addresses, with a significant majority coming from India. Co-founder Avery Ching highlighted India's crucial role, citing partnerships with major players like Reliance Jio and a focus on developing real-world applications and decentralized trading infrastructure. The company is also involved in government blockchain pilots in states like Telangana.

item.title: India's AI Revolution: Founders Leapfrog Silicon Valley's Decade-Long Lead!
item.description: Elevation Capital's AI partner Krishna Mehra states India has significantly narrowed the Artificial Intelligence gap with Silicon Valley, potentially only six months to a year behind. He urges Indian founders to build category-leading global companies, emphasizing the need for rapid product iteration and early validation with international customers.

item.title: Precious Metals Plunge: Gold, Silver Retreat From Peaks - What Investors MUST Know Now!
item.description: Silver dropped from its record $80 per ounce peak, and gold eased from historic highs as investors took profits. Reduced geopolitical tensions, particularly concerning Ukraine peace talks, also curbed safe-haven demand. Platinum and palladium saw significant declines. Meanwhile, UBS raised its gold price outlook to $5,000 per ounce by 2026, citing factors like lower yields and economic concerns. Investors now await US Federal Reserve meeting minutes for interest rate clues.

item.title: India's Farming Future: Syngenta's AI App Connects Millions of Smallholders to Tech & Markets!
item.description: Syngenta Group is expanding its 'Cropwise Grower' digital platform for smallholder farmers in India. The app provides access to technology, market prices, and agronomist services in local languages, utilizing AI and satellite imagery for seed selection and pest detection. Currently serving 2.38 million farmers, Syngenta plans to integrate with the agriculture ministry's VISTAAR initiative, offering virtual classrooms and access to credit and digital marketplaces. The company also launched drone services via the app and is developing an AI chatbot.

item.title: India's FMCG Giant HUL Faces Historic Reset: First Woman CEO Priya Nair Takes Charge Amidst Fierce Competition!
item.description: Priya Nair has become Hindustan Unilever's (HUL) first woman CEO and Managing Director, inheriting a legacy FMCG giant at a critical juncture. Facing sluggish growth, intense competition from niche and regional players, and evolving consumer habits, Nair's mandate is to restore growth and agility. Her strategy involves focusing on high-growth demand areas, reviving volume, and investing in emerging niche categories to navigate the challenging market landscape.

item.title: India Gears Up to Host Global AI Summit 2026: Will it Forge World's AI Rulebook?
item.description: India is set to host the AI Summit in February 2026, aiming to build a shared global understanding and consensus on artificial intelligence governance. Expected to draw over 100 countries, the summit will feature high-profile attendees including Bill Gates, CEOs from Anthropic and Adobe, and the French President, positioning India as a key convenor in global tech policy.

item.title: India's Next Tech Revolution Funded? IAN Group Closes $100 Million Alpha Fund for Deep Tech & Defence Stars!
item.description: IAN Group's second venture capital fund, the IAN Alpha Fund, has closed at $100 million. This fund will invest in deep technology startups and MSMEs crucial for India's strategic priorities, including semiconductors, defence tech, AI, biotech, and climate solutions. Despite cautious early-stage funding, the fund aims to back companies solving real problems with global scalability. IAN Group's track record and focus on commercial readiness are key to attracting investors. The fund typically invests $2 million per startup.

item.title: Jio SMOKES Competition in 5G! OpenSignal Reveals Shocking Speed & Availability Lead - Are Others Left Behind?
item.description: Jio has emerged as the leader in 5G speed, signal availability, and subscriber utilization, according to a new report by broadband research firm Open Signal. The study, covering data from September 1 to November 30, 2025, shows Jio's 5G download speeds reaching 199.7 Mbps, significantly faster than competitors Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea. Jio's network consistently provides users with 5G connectivity for a majority of their usage time, highlighting the effectiveness of its Standalone architecture.

item.title: Informatica CEO: India is Not Just a Market, It's Our AI Innovation Engine!
item.description: Informatica CEO Amit Walia highlights India's crucial role in the company's global strategy, emphasizing it as a core innovation hub. With over half its global workforce based in India, the company is leveraging its Bengaluru, Hyderabad, and Chennai centers, particularly iLabs, to drive advancements in AI-powered data management. Informatica's Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) platform is designed to help Indian enterprises navigate complex data challenges, ensure data reliability for AI adoption, and scale digital initiatives with confidence amidst rising regulatory demands.

item.title: Fog Chaos! Delhi Airport Grounds Flights; IndiGo, Air India Warn of Mass Cancellations - Are You Affected?
item.description: Dense fog has enveloped Delhi and large parts of North, East, and Northeast India, leading to significant flight disruptions. Indira Gandhi International Airport has activated CAT-3 procedures due to visibility dropping to just 50 meters. Major airlines like IndiGo and Air India have issued advisories warning passengers of potential delays and cancellations, urging them to confirm flight status before heading to the airport. The aviation regulator, DGCA, has designated December 10, 2025, to February 10, 2026, as the official fog window.

item.title: Bandhan Bank Offloads Rs 6,872 Crore Bad Loans: What Investors Need to Know!
item.description: Bandhan Bank has completed the sale of approximately ₹6,872 crore worth of identified unsecured non-performing asset (NPA) and written-off loan portfolios to Asset Reconstruction Companies (ARCs). The bank sold an NPA portfolio of ₹3,165.25 crore principal for ₹569.75 crore to ARCIL, and a written-off portfolio of ₹3,707.11 crore principal for ₹331.97 crore to Phoenix ARC, both on a security receipts basis. This move aims to clean up the bank's balance sheet.

item.title: Waaree Energies Shocker: CEO Amit Paithankar to Step Down in 2026! Who's Next?
item.description: Waaree Energies announced that Whole-Time Director and CEO Amit Paithankar will resign effective May 15, 2026, to pursue external opportunities. The board has appointed Jignesh Rathod, currently Director-Operations, as CEO-Designate, ensuring leadership continuity. Rathod brings over 18 years of experience in operations and capacity expansion to the role.

item.title: Fog Alert! Indian Railways Rolls Out Emergency Plan to Keep Vande Bharat & Shatabdi on Time This Winter!
item.description: The Ministry of Railways is implementing real-time train checks and ensuring availability of spare rakes, including 20-car Vande Bharat sets, to maintain punctuality during the winter fog season. Measures cover catering and housekeeping services, with direct monitoring by the Railway Board via war rooms to prevent delays.

item.title: Shriram Finance Achieves Top-Tier AAA Credit Rating: What This Means for Investors!
item.description: Shriram Finance Ltd. announced a significant credit rating upgrade by CARE Ratings Limited. Its non-convertible debentures and subordinated debt have been elevated to 'CARE AAA; Stable,' the highest possible rating, from 'CARE AA+; Stable.' The company's commercial paper program also received a reaffirmation of 'CARE A1+,' indicating top-tier short-term credit quality. This upgrade reflects the agency's positive assessment of Shriram Finance's operational and financial performance.

item.title: India's Energy Giant EESL Seeks $723M Sale of Smart Meter JV Amidst Debt Crisis!
item.description: Cash-strapped Energy Efficiency Services Ltd (EESL) and the National Investment and Infrastructure Fund (NIIF) are selling their IntelliSmart joint venture for an estimated $723 million. Advised by Deloitte, the sale aims to help EESL significantly reduce its ₹6,049 crore debt pile. This strategic move is vital for EESL's financial recovery and supports India's ambitious $30 billion smart metering program.

item.title: Telecom Security Rules Extended! Govt Slashes Lab Fees, Speeds Up 5G & Broadband Rollout
item.description: India's Department of Telecommunications has extended the telecom equipment security certification scheme for one year, ensuring continuity for testing and certification. The government also reduced application fees for Telecom Security Testing Laboratories (TSTLs) and simplified security norms for Optical Network Terminator (ONT) devices. These measures aim to lower compliance costs, accelerate approvals, and boost the faster deployment of 5G and fibre broadband networks while supporting domestic manufacturing.

item.title: India Extends Oil & Gas Block Bids: HUGE Opportunity for Investors?
item.description: India's Directorate General of Hydrocarbons (DGH) has extended the bid submission deadline for its latest oil and gas block auctions, including OALP-X, DSF, and CBM rounds, until February 18, 2026. This third extension, for up to six more weeks, aims to attract more investors and boost domestic energy production, potentially reducing the nation's significant oil import bill. The OALP-X round alone offers 25 blocks covering over 191,986 sq km.

item.title: Indian Railways' Fare Hike Puzzle: Small Changes, Big Financial Questions!
item.description: Indian Railways has implemented two passenger fare increases this fiscal year, but critics argue they are too small to address the core financial issues. The hikes, aimed at closing the revenue-expenditure gap and maintaining an operating ratio below 100%, are seen as populist and insufficient. The article questions the pricing of premium trains and suggests an independent tariff commission for rational fare revisions, highlighting the unsustainable reliance on freight revenue and the general budget.

item.title: Indian Pharma Giants Brace for Impact: Crucial GMP Deadline Sparks Industry Plea for More Time!
item.description: India's smaller drug manufacturers are scrambling to meet the revised Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) deadline of December 31, 2025. Companies with annual turnover below ₹250 crore are seeking a 12-month extension, citing challenges in acquiring equipment and sourcing finance. Industry representatives are hopeful for a government reprieve, especially in light of recent cough syrup-related health concerns, as a significant portion of these units may be impacted.

item.title: India's Startup Funding Surge: VCs Bet Big on Fewer, Established Giants!
item.description: Late-stage startup funding in India showed resilience in 2025, raising $18 billion, up from $15 billion a year ago, despite fewer deals. Investors increasingly prefer scaled, revenue-generating companies with clear exit potential, while early-stage funding faces pressure. This trend reflects the maturity of India's venture ecosystem and a shift towards profitability and near-term liquidity.

item.title: India Shatters Clean Energy Records: 44.5 GW Added in 2025, Surpassing Global Goals!
item.description: India has achieved a landmark year for clean energy, adding a record 44.5 GW of renewable capacity by November 2025. This massive expansion brings the nation's total non-fossil fuel power capacity to 262.74 GW, now representing over 51% of its total installed capacity. Driven primarily by solar energy additions, this achievement helps India meet its Paris Agreement targets five years ahead of schedule and positions it as a global leader in renewable energy. This momentum supports the ambitious goal of reaching 500 GW non-fossil energy capacity by 2030.

item.title: Nabard Halts Huge ₹7,000 Crore Bond Issue: Is Your Money Safe?
item.description: State-owned Nabard has canceled its planned ₹7,000 crore bond issuance for the second time due to persistently high yields at the shorter end of the debt market. This indicates that the Reserve Bank of India's recent rate cuts are not effectively lowering borrowing costs, mirroring similar withdrawals by Power Finance Corporation and signaling potential market stress.

item.title: RBI Approves Indian Overseas Bank's Global Leap: New Unit at GIFT City Set to Revolutionize Forex Operations!
item.description: Indian Overseas Bank has secured approval from the Reserve Bank of India to establish an International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) Banking Unit in Gujarat's GIFT City. This strategic move allows the public sector lender to expand its international financial services offerings and strengthen its presence in a key global financial hub, as detailed in a recent regulatory filing.

item.title: Cantor Fitzgerald Forecasts Crypto Winter 2026: Is This the Calm Before Institutional Storm?
item.description: Cantor Fitzgerald analysts predict a 'crypto winter' starting in 2026, potentially pressuring Bitcoin prices. However, they see this downturn paving the way for a more stable, institutionally-driven crypto market. Key growth areas identified include Real-World Asset (RWA) tokenization, which could exceed $50 billion by 2026, and the increasing market share of Decentralized Exchanges (DEXs). The recent passage of the US CLARITY Act is expected to provide regulatory clarity, encouraging greater institutional involvement.

item.title: IndiGo's Pilot Pay Hike: A Fix for Mass Cancellations or Just More Costs?
item.description: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is increasing pilot allowances and introducing new ones, effective January 1. This action follows weeks of mass flight cancellations attributed to poor roster planning, which stranded thousands of passengers. The move aims to boost pilot morale and combat competition from foreign carriers, while the airline faces regulatory scrutiny and warnings of financial damage from Moody's Ratings.

item.title: RBI Issues Stern Warning: Microlenders Must Monitor Mounting Stress!
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India has directed microfinance institutions to closely monitor stress build-up in their loan portfolios. This directive comes as the RBI's Trend and Progress in Banking Report for FY25 notes lower disbursements in southern states, despite industry efforts and self-regulatory measures like guardrails to ensure steady growth. The central bank aims to foster systemic and sustainable growth while promoting financial inclusion.

item.title: India's Fertiliser Imports Skyrocket 60%: Winter Crops Boom or Subsidy Shock Looming?
item.description: India's fertiliser imports surged 60% to 17.37 million tonnes in April-November FY26, driven by strong winter crop sowing and robust monsoon rains. This trend ensures adequate supply but raises concerns over a potentially larger government subsidy bill. Imports of urea and DAP saw particularly sharp increases, highlighting domestic demand and import reliance.
